What is the difference between an assignment of payment and a successor-in-interest contract?
What is the difference between an assignment of
payment and a successor-in-interest contract?

➢ Assignment of payment: Payment is issued to a third party of the assignor’s choice. Tobacco quota holder or producer will continue as contract holder and must abide by terms of contract.
➢ Assignment of payment: Payment is issued to a third party of ➢ A s s i g n m e n t
o f
p a y m e n t : P a y m e n t
i s
i s s u e d

a
t h i r d
p a r t y
o f
the assignor’s choice. Tobacco quota holder or producer will
continue as contract holder and must abide by terms of
contract.

➢ Successor-in-interest contract: The original contract holder no longer has a contract with CCC. All future payments will be issued to the successor who must abide by terms of contract.
➢ Successor-in-interest contract: The original contract holder no ➢ S u c c e s s o r - i n - i n t e r e s t
c o n t r a c t : T h e
o r i g i n a l
c o n t r a c t
h o l d e r
n o
longer has a contract with CCC. All future payments will be
issued to the successor who must abide by terms of contract.

➢ Assignment of payment transfers the rights to the payment to a third party; successor-in-interest transfers the contract to a third party.
